impact-statement: Rare mutations in the switch III region of Ras can increase its nanoscale clustering, which enhances effector recruitment and downstream signaling.

contribution.con1: MS, Acquired and analyzed FRET and cellular data, designed the experiments and wrote the manuscript
contribution.con2: AL, Analyzed nucleotide exchange data, purified proteins, acquired and analyzed anisotropy binding data
contribution.con3: OB, Acquired and analyzed GAP-dependent and independent Ras-activity, acquired anisotropy binding data and purified proteins
contribution.con4: AJ, Carried out the bioinformatic analyses and cancer genome database mining
contribution.con5: YZ, Acquired, analyzed and designed EM experiments
contribution.con6: HL, Performed western blot experiments for MAPK signaling of H-ras mutants
contribution.con7: BL, Performed western blot experiments for MAPK signaling of K-ras and N-ras mutants
contribution.con9: CG, Analyzed confocal microscopy and anchorage-independent growth data, and assisted in analysis of PC12 cell and focus formation data and statistics
contribution.con13: DA, Conceived the project, designed the experiments and wrote the manuscript
contribution.con10: HH, Conceived the nucleotide exchange assay
